result.title: D5.4 Analysis of the relationships between individual characteristics, social factors, and media design, and citizens’ approach to misinformation
result.description: D5.4 Analysis of the relationships between individual characteristics, social factors, and media design, and citizens’ approach to misinformation [M34](R, PU): This deliverable will report on the correlated impact of various citizen characteristics (e.g., gender, location, language), media designs (e.g., misinformation style, topic, method of delivery), on how the citizen is likely to deal with misinformation (e.g., ignore, share, comment on, refute, endorse, question).

result.title: D3.3 Cascading patterns and predictors of misinformation flow
result.description: D3.3 Cascading patterns and predictors of misinformation flow [M24](R, PU): Following the work in T3.3, this deliverable will describe all identified misinformation cascading patterns, and any topological and typological network dependencies.

result.title: D5.6 Report on summative procedures and findings for the three stakeholder groups
result.description: D5.6 Report on summative procedures and findings for the three stakeholder groups [M40](R, PU): This deliverable will summarise the various evaluation procedures used in the project, and their outcomes (T5.2-3)when applied to citizens, journalists, and policymakers. It will also report on the evaluation results of T5.4 model on policy formation. It will also consist of recommendations to policymakers and journalists stakeholder groups for maximizing the impact of the Co-Inform platform.

result.title: Optimized CUTLER BPM based on the evaluation feedback from the city pilots
result.description: D7.4 is re-iterating the CUTLER BPM and outlining the path to market readiness, incorporating the feedback received from the city pilots. D7.4 will explore methodologies and techniques for developing a generic BPM for using information-based, big-data applications for policy-development. This shall safeguard the principle usability of the project results beyond the scope of the project.
